page.title: 11TWO MONUMENTS
page.content:
The Martyrs' monument is an obelisk 45ft. high and it was erected in 1842 to commemorate the martyrs who were burned to death between 1528-1558. They were Patrick Hamilton, Henry Forrest,George Wishart and Walter Mill. At that time, St.Andrews was the ecclesiastical capital of Scotland and was the centre of the religious struggles before the Reformation.
A monument to the South of the R.& A. commemorates Lord Lyon Playfair of St.Andrews, PC,GCB,LLD,FRS.(1828-1898) His career was a combined devotion to science and a rare dedication to public welfare. His parliamentary career began in 1868 when he was elected Liberal member of the newly created Scottish University seat of St.Andrews and Edinburgh.
